Determine what it means for the polynomial p(x) to be divisible by 7 for any integer x.
Evaluate p(x) at specific values of x (like 0, 1, -1, 2, -2, etc.) to establish equations for the coefficients under the condition that p(x) % 7 = 0.
Analyze the resulting system of congruences for a, b, c, d, and e modulo 7.
Derive conditions that the coefficients a, b, c, d, e must satisfy individually for p(x) % 7 = 0.
Sum the modulo results of the coefficients (a mod 7) + (b mod 7) + (c mod 7) + (d mod 7) + (e mod 7).
Examine possible values of this sum under the constraints derived from the polynomial being divisible by 7 for all integer values of x.
Confirm the consistency and validity of these values against each assessed point.

What does it mean for \( p(x) \) to be divisible by 7 for every integer \( x \)?
How can one use the properties of polynomial congruences to simplify this problem?
Replace \( x \) by all integers from 0 to 6 (since 7 is prime, these are the complete set of residues modulo 7) and understand the implications on the polynomial \( p(x) \).
Calculate \( p(x) \) mod 7 for all these values of \( x \) and set up the resulting system of congruences.
Solve the system of congruences for the coefficients \( a, b, c, d, \) and \( e \).
Determine \( a \mod 7, b \mod 7, c \mod 7, d \mod 7, \) and \( e \mod 7 \).
Compute the sum \( (a \mod 7) + (b \mod 7) + (c \mod 7) + (d \mod 7) + (e \mod 7) \).
Identify the possible values of the sum based on the values the coefficients can take modulo 7.

Recognize the significance of \( p(x) \) being divisible by 7 for all integer \( x \), specifically, why \( p(x) \equiv 0 \pmod{7} \) for every \( x \).
Analyze the general form \( p(x) = ax^4 + bx^3 + cx^2 + dx + e \) and establish what it means for each coefficient when taken modulo 7.
Determine the effect of evaluating \( p(0) \), \( p(1) \), \( p(-1) \), \( p(2) \), \( p(-2) \), \( p(3) \), and \( p(-3) \) all modulo 7.
Determine potential values of \( a \), \( b \), \( c \), \( d \), and \( e \) modulo 7 from the evaluations of \( p(x) \) at these test points.
Calculate possible values of \( (a \mod 7) + (b \mod 7) + (c \mod 7) + (d \mod 7) + (e \mod 7) \) based on the identified potential values of \( a \), \( b \), \( c \), \( d \), and \( e \).
Verify that the sum is consistent across all integer \( x \) modulo 7 and satisfies the condition \( p(x) \equiv 0 \pmod{7} \).
